website_summaries.verdict: A starter field guide geared toward young naturalists.
pros: Small enough to comfortably take with you on a hike
Written in an easily understandable way
A good book that will pique the interest of most people
cons: This user-friendly book does not feature as many wildflowers as some others available

customer_reviews.title: inspiring, comes alive
customer_reviews.text: An awesome guide. Just simple enough to start an interest, and very engaging. Designed with a great eye this guide is more than beautiful. I also recommend "Rocks & Minerals", "Insects" and "Birds", in the same series. (There are more in the series, but those I'm not familiar with) So glad to add this to my shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Clover

customer_reviews.title: Identify flowers
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book to take on hikes since it is small and will fit in a pocket. Made a great gift for my grandchildren.
customer_reviews.author: MzCher

customer_reviews.title: Great Field Guide
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves these field guides and constantly had them checked out from the school library, so I bought her a copy. She absolutely loved this present!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Alkire

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use Guide-color coded!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use field guide, entire book is color coded for easy look up of flowers. Informative. Nice size to carry along. Affordable. Fast ship. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amy D.

customer_reviews.title: Check publication date
customer_reviews.text: A bit out of date, lacking information on familiar topics. I would love to see these published new and updated.
customer_reviews.author: Red22

customer_reviews.title: National Audubon Society First Field Guide - Wildflowers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book for my preschool grandchildren that I care for part time. I had purchased the shell book at a garage sale & they loved it. So I went online to find other book in the same series. It is something that I can enjoy with them together.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: This book was a big hit with the grandsons! Both boys are very much into mother nature and this book fit the bill so to speak!
customer_reviews.author: Joan Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old daughter loved this book! And I know she will enjoy it for many years to come! Highly recommend this book!
customer_reviews.author: namlet2012

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful introduction to field guides for the elementary set.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Marr

customer_reviews.title: Fun outdoor guide
customer_reviews.text: All of the books in this series are excellent, not just for children. All the typical species that one might encounter in a particular environment are represented. If you need more, move on to a Peterson or Audubon Field Guide, but for most folks & certainly for most children this is more than enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jfm
